alert.note: Alert for Pittsylvania (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 11 at 10:22AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Pittsylvania County through 1045 AM EST... At 1022 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Keeling, or near Ingram, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gretna... Mt Airy... Java... Chalk Level... and Keeling. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. If the storm intensifies and rotation strengthens, a warning may need to be issued.Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. If the storm intensifies and rotation strengthens, a warning may need to be issued. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 PM EST for north central North Carolina...and central and south central Virginia.
